EV App

This cross-platform mobile application was developed in 2019 during my internship with the clean energy research centre Merida Labs. From initial mockups to a functional product, I was the only developer working on the application. It remains one of the largest projects I have been involved with and an informative experience with full stack development.

At its core, the application connects users to their local electric vehicle charging infrastructure, providing locations and information on local charging stations through a map interface.

This information was obtained from the Open Charge Map API, and is filterable on attributes such as charger type and cost. The app was also connected to a MySQL database to support the logging of information including the most high traffic times for a given charging station.

Created with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, PHP, and SQL.
